description.en: The course is 100% web-based (in the Moodle). First, the students are introduced to a comprehensive understanding of collaborative learning through a framework of collaborative problem solving skills. Next, students complete a group assignment related to a collaborative problem solving activity. Once completed, they individually analyse the results from other groups, which are subsequently discussed in a webinar. Next, teaching of collaborative learning is introduced using instructional design principles found in cooperative learning. Then the second group assignment is posted in which students work together to prepare a presentation that will teach their classmates in the other groups about a topic provided by the instructor. Students work on this second assignment in steps with weekly deadlines. A final webinar is held to discuss the presentations from each group. Finally, the course finishes with an examination in the form of an e-test.
description.et: Kursus on 100% veebipõhine (Moodle'is). Esmalt selgitatakse üliõpilastele koostöise õppe ehk ühesõppe mõistet, rakendades selleks koostöiste probleemilahendamise oskuste raamistikku. Järgneb rühmaülesanne - koostöise probleemilahendamise ülesanne. Pärast ülesande lahendamist analüüsib iga rühmaliige teise rühma tulemusi, mida seejärel arutatakse nii foorumi kui vebinari vormis. Järgmisena tutvustatakse üliõpilastele koostöise õppe õpetamist, rakendades selleks ühisõppe õpikavanduse põhimõtteid. Seejärel postitatakse teine grupiülesanne. Selles valmistavad õpilased koos ette ettekande, milles õpetada teistele gruppidele õpetaja antud teemat. Õpilased täidavad iga nädal ülesande mõne etapi. Iga rühma esitluste üle arutlemiseks peetakse lõpus veebiseminar. Kursus lõpeb eksamiga, mis toimub e-testi vormis.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to introduce a comprehensive understanding of collaborative learning through a framework of collaborative problem solving skills and to introduce principles for successfully teaching collaborative learning.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on aidata üliõpilastel omandada põhjalik arusaam koostöisest õppest ehk ühesõppest, rakendades selleks koostöiste probleemilahendamise oskuste raamistikku, ning tutvustada neile põhimõtteid koostöise õppe edukaks õpetamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing this course, students will be able to:
(1) identify and understand different elements of collaborative learning;
learning_outcomes.et: (1) suudab tuvastada ja mõista koostöise õppe erinevaid elemente;

learning_outcomes.en: (2) identify instructional principles for teaching collaborative learning;
learning_outcomes.et: (2) oskab tuvastada koostöise õppe õpetamise põhimõtteid;

learning_outcomes.en: (3) analyse and assess collaborative learning activities;
learning_outcomes.et: (3) oskab analüüsida ja hinnata koostöiseid õpitegevusi;

learning_outcomes.en: (4) critically think about methods for assessing collaboration skills.
learning_outcomes.et: (4) oskab mõelda kriitiliselt koostööoskuste hindamise meetoditele.

independent_work.et:
1. Reading course materials in Moodle and participating in webinars..
2. Completing two group assignments.
3. Giving feedback to peer groups about their assignments.
4. Evaluating assignments of the peer groups.

Guidelines are given in Moodle.

description.et:
The group assignments will be evaluated by peer students (30% of points) and teachers (70% of points). 

The sum of average scores of peers and teachers (30/70) will be used for the final score. They will get a mark:
A - 91-100% of maximum score
B - 81-90% of maximum score
C - 71-80% of maximum score
D - 61-70% of maximum score
E - 51-60% of maximum score
F (failed) - 50% or of the maximum score or at least one of the criteria is assessed 50% or less from the maximum.

The students complete an online test. Students are allowed to use all materials available in Internet but not the help of peer students.
They will get a mark:
A - 91-100% of correct answers
B - 81-90% of correct answers
C - 71-80% of correct answers
D - 61-70% of correct answers
E - 51-60% of correct answers
F (failed) - 50% or less correct answers or at least one of the expected learning outcomes is not achieved at the E level.

grade_preconditions.et:
The problem tasks, feedback to peer students and evaluations of peer students' problem tasks have to be submitted before the examination.
The students have to participate in the online discussions about course materials.

grade_evaluation.et: Assessment is based on the two group assignments (25% each) and the final achievement test (50%). All of them should be completed at least at E-level. The final score is based on the average of the scores in both assessment methods.

debt_elimination.et: According to the agreement with the teacher in charge, following the rules set in university's study regulations.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
